title: Draymond upset with 'agenda' after drawing tech
content: Warriors star Draymond Green, who received his fifth technical foul of the playoffs Thursday night, expressed frustration over what he called an "agenda" to make him out to be an "angry Black man."

title: Texans rookie Higgins makes history with deal

title: Irked Devers tells Red Sox he won't switch to 1B

title: Report: Pacers' Haliburton warned for G2 dance

title: Indo-Pak tension: High vigil and security arrangements at Almatti and other dams

title: Opinion: Opinion | Are India-Pakistan Stuck In A Deterrence-And-Escalation Cycle?
content: Deterrence between India and Pakistan is fragile, but India's capacity to deter Pakistan's use of terrorism as an instrument of state policy will require more than kinetic strikes, as we have witnessed over the last two days.

title: India Pakistan Attack Live Updates: Pakistan Used 300-400 Drones To Target 36 Sites In India, Says Centre
content: Operation Sindoor Live Updates: Pakistan's forces launched multiple attacks using drones and other munitions along the entire western border on the intervening night of Thursday and Friday, which were "effectively repulsed", the Indian Army said.

title: Cinema Halls, Shopping Malls To Remain Shut From Sunrise To Sunset In Mohali
content: The district administration in Punjab's Mohali on Friday ordered the closure of cinema halls and shopping malls from sunset to sunrise till further orders, officials said.

title: India's Simple Answer To Pak Disinformation, Propaganda: Meticulous Evidence
content: Ensuring that Pakistan has no way to obfuscate and hide behind propaganda, India is documenting evidence of its strikes on terror infrastructure in the country as part of Operation Sindoor.

title: Home Ministry Urges States To Strengthen Civil Defence Amid Hostile Threats
content: In light of the current security environment and the threat of hostile attacks, the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) has urged all states and Union Territories (UTs) to augment civil defence measures under the Civil Defence Act and Rules of 1968.

title: Is NSA Ajit Doval On Facebook? Government Fact Check Exposes Fake Post
content: Pakistan's disinformation machinery has once again come under the spotlight, this time for targeting India's National Security Advisor (NSA) Ajit Doval through a fake Facebook post.

content: Indian equity markets opened lower this morning amid heightened tensions with Pakistan over an anti-terrorism operation by New Delhi in the aftermath of the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: Day after Pak Escalation, Army Blasts Explosive Found In Amritsar Field
content: The Indian Army successfully detonated an unexploded ordnance in Punjab's Amritsar. The nature of the ordnance, which was found in the Makhan Windy village, is unclear.

title: Bengal Private Schools Declare Early Summer Holidays After Mamata Banerjee's Appeal

title: Simhachalam temple wall collapse: Missed writing on the wall

As stunned kin demand answers, details of neglect of the temple’s infrastructure and oversight in festival arrangements emerge, write B Madhu Gopal and Harish Gilai

content: As Hyderabad’s vertical ambitions soar, so do chilling tales of neglect hidden behind painted walls and polished lobbies. From toddlers to professionals, fatal lift accidents are laying bare gaping holes in regulation, oversight and everyday safety. In a city obsessed with speed and scale, safety has become an afterthought. Lavpreet Kaur charts the disasters that are flying under the radar

title: Karnataka’s MMR reduces to 63 per lakh live births, but is still highest among southern States
content: The six-point decline in Karnataka is the highest among southern States, followed by Tamil Nadu where MMR has reduced by five points. Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, and Kerala have shown a reverse trend with an increase in MMR by one or two points

title: A silent burden: Thalassaemia patients in Karnataka battle disease with hope and hardship
content:
Access to public health for patients with blood disorders like thalassaemia has improved over the years, but it still remains fragmented and inconsistent. Most families spend thousands every month for the long-drawn treatment, and the only permanent curative option is beyond the reach of most, finds Afshan Yasmeen. 
May 8 is observed as World Thalassaemia Day.

title: Blackout enforced in Punjab districts; drones neutralised in Jalandhar
content: In Jalandhar, some drones were spotted that neutralised at around 11.20 p.m. by security forces, as per official sources

content: The central government has empowered the Army Chief to call out “every officer and every enrolled person” of the Territorial Army to provide for essential guard or to be embodied to support or supplement the regular Army.

title: Odisha to make its roads ‘disaster resilient’ as part of ₹1000 crore project
content: The government will raise road embankments above flood level, provide protection walls and stone pitching works, to prevent erosion, and also cross drainage structures

content: Two byelections in West Bengal are due — in the Kaliganj Assembly constituency and the Basirhat Parliamentary constituency — following the recent deaths of their respective legislators.

title: All educational institutes closed for two days in J&K: govt.
content: Decision comes after parts of Jammu region witnessed drone and missile attacks from Pakistan; CM Omar Abdullah says govt. will decide on May 12 regarding reopening

title: If Rohingya refugees are ‘foreigners’ under the Foreigners Act, they will be dealt with as per the law: SC

title: Two days of intense, substantive conversations on several critical fields at The Hindu Huddle
content: After a five-year pause, The Hindu Huddle has returned to Bengaluru as a marquee event of The Hindu Group

title: When sirens sound and bugles call
content: Reporters from Punjab and Rajasthan, both of which have borders with Pakistan, and the National Capital Region talk to civilians — regular citizens, members of the civil defence and emergency services — to understand preparedness and their experiences with the drills and blackouts that have come on the back of Operation Sindoor

title: X says it blocked 8,000 accounts in India after govt's executive orders
content: The platform said it received executive orders from the government requiring it to block over 8,000 accounts ‘subject to potential penalties including significant fines and imprisonment of the company’s local employees’

title: What are Songar drones Pak used to target Indian military sites?
content: In a recent press conference, Colonel Sofiya Qureshi revealed that Pakistan launched a massive drone intrusion, sending 300-400 drones across 36 locations from Leh to Sir Creek, targeting Indian military installations. Indian armed forces successfully intercepted many drones using both kinetic and non-kinetic methods.

title: Pak def min gives absurd excuse for army's failure to withstand Op Sindoor
content: Pakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif has made a bizarre claim that Pakistani forces deliberately avoided intercepting Indian drones to conceal strategic military locations. This justification follows India's 'Operation Sindoor,' precision strikes on terrorist spots, and the thwarting of Pakistani drone and missile attacks.

title: 'Invoke emergency powers under civil defence rules': MHA to all states, UTs
content: Amid escalating India-Pakistan tensions, the home ministry has directed states and Union territories to implement civil defence measures under the 1968 Act. This directive follows Pakistani drone and missile strikes in Jammu and Kashmir and Rajasthan, retaliating against India's Operation Sindoor, which targeted terrorist sites after the Pahalgama attack. Indian air defence systems successfully intercepted most threats.

title: Edelweiss CEO shares 3 'little ways' citizens can support Armed Forces
content: Amidst rising tensions, Edelweiss Mutual Fund CEO Radhika Gupta suggests three simple ways for Indian citizens to support the armed forces, including spreading accurate information, being a good national ambassador, and following rules. The IT ministry also issued an advisory for responsible online behavior, urging users to avoid misinformation.

title: Blackouts & Pak's failed attacks: 10 things that happened in last 36 hrs
content: Tensions escalate between India and Pakistan as India launches 'Operation Sindoor' targeting terrorist camps in response to the Pahalgam attack, neutralizing over 100 terrorists. Pakistan retaliates with drone and missile strikes, prompting India to counter-attack key military bases. Blackouts, curfews, and air raid warnings grip the region, with the IPL suspended amidst the ongoing conflict.

title: IPL 2025 players start dispersing, overseas lot to head back home too
content: Following security concerns and the suspension of the 2025 Indian Premier League for a week, franchises are arranging for players to return home. Overseas players, particularly anxious after an incident in Dharamsala, will be assisted by the BCCI in their departure. The BCCI has also released a statement expressing solidarity with the nation amidst recent events.

title: 26/11 Mumbai attack plotter Rana remanded to judicial custody till June 6
content: Tahawwur Rana, accused in the 2008 Mumbai terror attacks conspiracy, is now in judicial custody until June 6, 2025, following his extradition from the US. The NIA alleges Rana, a close associate of David Headley, was privy to the terror operation plans. Rana has sought permission to communicate with his family.

title: Bill Gates on his 'last chapter,' People will say a lot of things when I die, but...
content: Bill Gates will donate his wealth through the Gates Foundation. This will happen over the next 20 years. The Gates Foundation will close in 2045. Gates aims to reduce his net worth by 99%. The foundation will focus on global health and poverty. Gates wants to address urgent problems. He hopes to save millions of lives with this accelerated plan.

title: 'Buzdil' PM can't even take Modi's name: Pak MP slams Shehbaz Sharif
content: Pakistan's parliament witnessed heated debates as ministers clashed over the government's handling of the escalating conflict with India. MP Shahid Khattak criticized Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif for his perceived inaction and failure to condemn India and Prime Minister Modi. This occurred after India conducted precision strikes in PoK following terror attacks in Jammu and Kashmir.

title: IPL 2025 suspended for one week with immediate effect, confirms BCCI
content: The BCCI has suspended IPL 2025 for one week, effective immediately, due to recent events. This decision, impacting matches like Lucknow Super Giants versus Royal Challengers Bengaluru, follows concerns from franchisees, broadcasters, and sponsors. The board expressed solidarity with the nation, armed forces, and the government amidst ongoing challenges, prioritising national interest above all else.

title: Jeff Bezos loses World's Second-Richest man title to one of his biggest competitor
content: Mark Zuckerberg's fortune has surged past Jeff Bezos, making him the world's second-richest person, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. This shift occurred as Meta's shares outperformed Amazon's, with Meta reporting strong first-quarter revenue. Meanwhile, Elon Musk remains the wealthiest individual, boosted by increased Tesla shares following his commitment to reduce time spent on government duties.

title: Nifty, Sensex plunge over 1% as India-Pak tensions weigh
content: Operation Sindoor impact on Indian stock market today: Stock market indices Nifty and Sensex declined significantly by over 1 per cent on Friday amid escalating tensions between India and Pakistan.

title: '1971 war was not remotely as terrifying': Residents of border areas shell-shocked
content: Poonch endured intense Pakistani bombardment, unlike anything experienced even during the 1971 war, prompting widespread fear and displacement. Shelling damaged religious sites and homes, resulting in casualties, including a tabla player, a kirtan singer and a maulvi. Residents are now fleeing, seeking safety as they express the urgent need for civilian bunkers amidst escalating tensions.

title: Govt empowers Army chief to mobilise Territorial Army for support
content: Amid escalating tensions with Pakistan, the defence ministry has granted the Army Chief expanded authority to mobilise the Territorial Army. This decision, enabled by Rule 33 of the Territorial Army Rules 1948, allows for the deployment of Territorial Army units to bolster security and support regular army operations across various commands.

title: Watch: Indian Army defuses projectile-like object in Amritsar
content: Tensions escalate as the Indian Armed Forces defuse a projectile in Amritsar following reported Pakistani air strikes along the western border in Jammu and Kashmir and Punjab. The Indian Army responded to ceasefire violations and drone attacks, asserting its commitment to national sovereignty. These events follow heightened tensions after the Pahalgam terror attack and India's subsequent Operation Sindoor.

title: IPL 2025: 'We will blast your stadium' - DDCA receives threat email
content: The Delhi and District Cricket Association (DDCA) received a threatening email on Friday morning, warning of an imminent explosion at the Arun Jaitley Stadium. The stadium, which serves as the home ground for the Delhi Capitals, was scheduled to host an IPL 2025 match between DC and Gujarat Titans on May 11.

title: India proposes cutting tariff gap to clinch trade deal with Trump
content: India has proposed significantly reducing its tariff differential with the US to under 4% to secure exemptions from existing and future tariffs. This move aims to boost the $129 billion bilateral trade, currently favoring India with a $45.7 billion surplus.

title: Watch: BSF foils infiltration bid by terrorists along Pakistan border
content: On the night of May 8, 2025, the BSF successfully thwarted a major infiltration attempt by Pakistan along the International Border in Samba district, Jammu and Kashmir. Simultaneously, the Indian Army reported that Pakistan's armed forces initiated multiple drone and munition attacks along the western border and engaged in numerous ceasefire violations along the LoC.

title: 'Look who’s behind him': Indian envoy shows photo as proof of Pak's link to terrorism
content: Indian High Commissioner Vikram Doraiswami confronted Pakistan on Sky News, displaying a photograph of Pakistani military officials attending the funeral of terrorists killed in India's Operation Sindoor. He highlighted the presence of UN-designated terrorist Hafiz Abdur Rauf, brother of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief, leading funeral prayers. Doraiswami questioned Pakistan's system of giving state funerals to terrorists, emphasizing the message it sends.

title: 'No need to panic': Indian Oil dispels shortage fears as tensions with Pak escalate
content: Amid rising India-Pakistan tensions, Indian Oil Corporation (IOC) assured the public that there is no shortage of petrol, diesel, or LPG. This statement follows panic buying fueled by social media posts showing long queues at fuel stations, particularly in border states.

title: Fully intact, undetonated Chinese PL-15 missile found in Hoshiarpur
content: Following the interception of missiles and drones fired by Pakistan, remnants of a missile were discovered in Punjab's Hoshiarpur. Initial reports suggest the recovered missile might be a Chinese PL-15, potentially launched from a Pakistani JF-17. If confirmed, India could gain valuable insights into its technology, enhancing its defense capabilities and strategic advantage against China.

title: PIB trolls Pak with 'Golmaal' jibe as Islamabad seeks 'loans', then retracts
content: The Press Information Bureau (PIB) mocked Pakistan's government after its Economic Affairs Division seemingly appealed for more international loans due to losses from conflict. While Pakistan claimed the account was hacked, Moody's warned that escalating tensions with India could negatively impact Pakistan's growth and financial stability. Moody's anticipates minimal impact on India, except for increased defense spending.

title: Can Pakistan afford a war with India? Here's a reality check
content: India-Pakistan tensions impact: Escalating tensions with India pose a significant threat to Pakistan's fragile economic recovery, potentially derailing its IMF bailout program and access to international financing. Pakistan's vulnerability stems from its high external debt, limited foreign exchange reserves, and reliance on international aid.

title: IPL suspended: Which window can be used to complete the remaining 16 matches?
content: Following the one week suspension of the IPL 2025, India's tour of Bangladesh and participation in the Asia Cup later this year are now highly improbable. The BCCI might utilise the August-September window to conclude the IPL if required, even if it means cancelling the scheduled tour and Asia Cup participation.

title: When was the last time IPL stopped midway?
content: The IPL 2025 has been suspended due to escalating regional tensions and national security concerns following missile firings by Pakistan. The decision impacts the final 16 matches, with BCCI prioritising player safety after an earlier game postponement and airspace closures. Evacuation efforts are underway, with potential rescheduling options being explored for later in the year.

title: India-Pakistan tensions: What’s closed, emergency protocols & more
content: Amid escalating tensions between India and Pakistan, states bordering the neighboring country are implementing emergency measures. Delhi has heightened security and cancelled employee leaves, while Punjab, Jammu and Kashmir, Haryana, Rajasthan, and Himachal Pradesh have closed educational institutions following drone attacks.

title: Pak missile, drone attack foiled: How India's S-400 'Sudarshan Chakra' works
content: India's S-400 air defense system, known as "Sudarshan Chakra," successfully intercepted a Pakistani offensive involving drones and missiles. S-400 air defence system, with its extensive range and engagement capabilities, neutralised all incoming threats from Pakistan.

title: IPL teams make travel plans after league suspended
content: The IPL 2025 has been suspended due to heightened regional tensions between India and Pakistan following missile firings by the latter, all of which were successfully intercepted by the Indian defence forces. The fixture between Punjab Kings and Delhi Capitals was postponed on Thursday.

title: Pakistan appeals for loans citing 'heavy losses', later says X account hacked
content: Pakistan's Economic Affairs Division faced a social media controversy after a post, later claimed to be a hack, appealed for international loans amid escalating tensions with India. This occurred following India's "Operation Sindoor" in response to a terrorist attack, leading to retaliatory strikes and market instability, with the Karachi Stock Exchange plummeting.

title: L-70 guns, Schilka, S-400: Weapons India used to intercept Pak drones
content: On May 8-9, 2025, Pakistan's armed forces initiated multiple drone and munition attacks along the western border, accompanied by ceasefire violations along the Line of Control in Jammu and Kashmir. The Indian Army effectively repulsed these attacks, responding firmly with advanced weaponry and air defense systems. India also used S-400 missile systems to neutralize incoming threats.

title: 'With every decision taken ... ': Rohit Sharma to Indian Forces
content: Indian cricketer Rohit Sharma voiced his support for India's military actions against terror infrastructure in Pakistan, emphasizing national pride and urging caution against fake news. This statement followed India's strikes on terror targets in response to the Pahalgam attack, escalating tensions between the two nations. The match between Punjab Kings and Delhi Capitals in Dharamsala on Thursday was called off due to security concerns.

title: 'Bombs are coming': Cheerleader's terrifying video from PBKS vs DC match
content: BCCI is in a huddle after the match between Punjab Kings and Delhi Capitals was called off midway due to the cross-border tensions. The players and spectators were asked to evacuate the venue immediately and now the Indian cricket board has planned a special train to get the players, support staff and broadcast crew to safe zone.

title: Watch: Army releases video of its strong response to Pak amid drone attacks
content: Tensions have escalated along the western border as the Indian Army released footage of a Pakistani drone being shot down. This action follows a major assault by Pakistani Armed Forces involving drones, missiles, and ceasefire violations across Jammu and Kashmir. Indian forces repulsed the attacks, responding with force after Operation Sindoor targeted terror camps in retaliation for a prior attack.

title: Body found hanging in train toilet of Ahmedabad–Kolkata Express in MP
content: A passenger, estimated to be between 30 and 35 years old, was discovered deceased in a toilet aboard the Ahmedabad-Kolkata Express at Sagar railway station in Madhya Pradesh on Thursday. The train was temporarily stopped, and authorities are working to identify the victim, who was traveling in a general coach.

title: Bill Gates to donate 99% of his wealth— What will his children actually inherit?
content: Bill Gates, the tech billionaire, plans to donate 99% of his wealth to the Gates Foundation within 20 years, aiming to dissolve it by 2045. He wants to address urgent global issues, foregoing the label of 'dying rich.' Despite his $168 billion fortune, his children will inherit less than 1% to encourage their own success.

title: ‘Shoot to kill’ orders issued, Mumbai fishermen warned to stay away from oil rigs
content: Following heightened security concerns and recent drone attacks along the border, Maharashtra has issued 'shoot to kill' orders for unauthorized entries into offshore defense zones. The Fisheries Department urgently warned coastal fishermen to avoid oil rigs and restricted areas, providing no-fishing coordinates.

title: Air raid sirens blare in Ambala over possible Pakistan attack
content: Ambala residents were alerted to a potential attack from Pakistan as air raid sirens blared across the city at 10:22 am, prompting authorities to urge people to stay indoors. This warning follows heightened tensions after Operation Sindoor and mirrors a similar alert in Chandigarh on Friday, which suspended work at the Punjab and Haryana High Court.

title: No 'fidayeen' attack, no strike on port: PIB counters fake news flooding social media
content: The Press Information Bureau's Fact Check Unit has debunked a fake video circulated by Pakistani handles, falsely claiming the destruction of an Indian post. The PIB clarified that the video was staged propaganda, noting the non-existent "20 Raj Battalion.

title: 'Let's do our part': Neeraj Chopra's powerful message amid rising India-Pakistan tensions
content: Chopra, the double Olympic medallist in javelin, is set to compete at the Ostrava Golden Spike 2025 athletics meet on June 24 in the Czech Republic. After being forced to withdraw from the past two editions due to injury, he will finally aim to make his debut at the prestigious meet.

title: Drones, blackouts and sirens: What happened overnight in Jammu, Punjab and Rajasthan
content: Following heightened tensions and India's response to terror attacks, Jammu experienced explosions and a blackout early Friday, with security forces neutralizing threats. Simultaneously, Punjab and Rajasthan enforced blackouts amid reports of drone activity and explosions, prompting heightened security measures and investigations.

title: S-400, Spyder, Akash: India’s air defence systems explained
content: In a significant escalation, Indian armed forces successfully intercepted and neutralized over 50 swarm drones launched by Pakistan along the Line of Control and International Borders on May 8-9, 2025. The coordinated drone attacks and ceasefire violations were met with a robust response, utilizing advanced air defense systems.

title: Conflict widens, India targets Lahore, Pindi, Karachi after foiling multiple Pak attacks
content: Following escalating hostilities, India retaliated against Pakistan, targeting air defense systems and other strategic sites after thwarting missile and drone attacks on Indian military bases and civilian areas. Operation Sindoor is underway, with India responding to Pakistan's aggression with targeted strikes and forward deployments. The international community watches as tensions rise between the two nations.

title: Army foils Pakistan attempts to send swarm drones across LoC
content: On the night of May 8-9, 2025, the Indian Army successfully intercepted and downed over 50 Pakistani swarm drones attempting to breach the LoC and International Borders. This comprehensive counter-drone operation involved advanced weaponry and specialized counter-UAS equipment across multiple sectors. The attacks followed Indian precision strikes in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir under 'Operation Sindoor'.

title: Enter Sandman: Metallica brings seismic shift to Virginia Tech stadium
content: over 60,000 fans gathered at Virginia Tech's Lane Stadium for a night that created ground tremors . the iconic metal band finally brought their song "Enter Sandman" in front of this dedicated fan base . it was so well-received that it brought a seismic shift to the stadium .

title: What must Arsenal fix to win the Premier League next season?
content: alejandro Moreno slams arsenal for their dependence on set pieces after their Champions League exit . the gunners will stand in two lines and applaud their opponents onto the pitch . it would be their third consecutive runner-up finish and raise further questions about manager Mikel Arteta's ability to cap five years of sustained progress .

title: 2025 college baseball hitter rankings: The best hitters in the game
content: the best hitters in college baseball do I want in the batter's box for me right now? . the best cleanup hitter in Omaha, Nebraska is junior, 24 HRs, 52 RBIs, .326 BA Neville has been going off this year .

title: Is there a path for Belal to catch GSP?
content: belal "Remember the Name" Muhammad won the welterweight title last month . the nine-year veteran has been overlooked by fans and opponents alike . "i don't need the world to believe in me," he said .

title: Missing stars and missed 3s: Why the Cavs and Celtics are suddenly in massive holes
content: the Cleveland Cavaliers and Boston Celtics each won 60-plus games . there's no precedent in league history for what we saw in the opening days of the conference semifinals . a week ago, the playoffs ended with a 2-0 lead over the san francisco pacers .

title: Pound-for-pound rankings: Inoue retains spot, Canelo falls
content: Naoya Inoue beats Ramon Cardenas in the eighth round to retain his undisputed junior featherweight title . inoue threw only 152 punches, the second-lowest total in a 12-round fight in CompuBox's 40-year history . canelo now moves on to a fight against Terence Crawford on sept. 12 in Las Vegas .

title: Bold predictions on Matthew Golden, Travis Hunter, other top rookies
content: Packers head coach Matt LaFleur joins "the Pat McAfee Show" and talks about adding Matthew Golden to his roster . a dozen of our experts weigh in with their opinions on everything that went down in Green Bay .

title: NBA conference semifinals: Wolves take Game 2 over Warriors
content: the second round of the 2025 playoffs is here, and our insiders have you covered for every game of the Eastern and Western conference semifinals . the no. 4 seed Indiana Pacers kicked off the East semis by taking home-court advantage away from the Cleveland Cavaliers with a 121-112 victory .
